unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Data Plan Overhaul Amidst Increased Demand**
normalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Data Plan Overhaul Amidst Increased Demand**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – October 26, 2023 – Leading telecom operators are revising their data plans following a surge in data consumption driven by increased adoption of OTT platforms and digital services. Reliance Jio, Airtel, and Vodafone Idea are all reportedly planning to introduce revamped packages targeting different consumer segments.
normalised: New Delhi, India – October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – Leading telecom operators are revising their data plans following a surge in data consumption driven by increased adoption of O T T platforms and digital services. Reliance Jio, Airtel, and Vodafone Idea are all reportedly planning to introduce revamped packages targeting different consumer segments.

unnormalised: "The average data consumption per user has skyrocketed, mirroring the digital transformation highlighted in films like '3 Idiots,' where technology empowers even the most remote learners," stated a senior analyst at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi.
normalised: "The average data consumption per user has skyrocketed, mirroring the digital transformation highlighted in films like 'three Idiots,' where technology empowers even the most remote learners," stated a senior analyst at the Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Delhi.

unnormalised: The changes are expected to include tiered data plans with varying data limits and validity periods. Some operators are considering offering bundled plans with subscriptions to popular streaming services like Netflix and Amazon Prime. Concerns remain regarding affordability, especially for rural consumers who rely heavily on subsidized data packs. Industry experts predict a possible 5-10% increase in prices across the board, citing rising infrastructure costs and spectrum charges. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is closely monitoring the developments to ensure fair pricing and competition. A 400 km fiber optic cable project is also underway to improve internet access in Jammu and Kashmir. Some plans are rumored to start from Rs. 149.
